alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 1:43AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Phelps, Gosper, southeastern Dawson, Furnas and western Harlan Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 141 AM CDT, doppler radar and automated weather stations reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Johnson Lake to 10 miles south of Wilsonville. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Doppler Radar and Automated Weather Station. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Smithfield around 150 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Johnson Lake, Elwood, Bertrand, Arapahoe, Beaver City, Oxford, and Overton. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 231 and 254. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska.
